form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Schumer (for himself, Mr. Cardin, Mr. Casey, Mr. Carper, Mr. Menendez, Mr. Merkley, Mrs. Gillibrand, Mr. Blumenthal, and Mr. Markey) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to equalize the exclusion from gross income of parking and transportation fringe benefits and to provide for a common cost-of-living adjustment, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Commuter Benefits Equity Act of 2015.

section.header: Uniform dollar limitation for all types of transportation fringe benefits

subsection.text: Section 132(f)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking $100 in subparagraph (A) and inserting $250,
by striking $175 in subparagraph (B) and inserting $250, and

subsection.text: Subparagraph (A) of section 132(f)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.

section.text: Section 7905 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2)(C) by inserting and after the semicolon;
in paragraph (3) by striking ; and and inserting a period; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)(A) by amending subparagraph (A) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: a qualified transportation fringe as defined in section 132(f)(1) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986;
